unnormalised: The Govt. has announced a new education scheme, "Padhai ka Jugaad," launching on 1/4/2025. Finally, a scheme that understands our struggle! Apparently, it gives students a Rs. 5000 monthly allowance to "explore educational opportunities." Which, let's be honest, will probably go straight to Maggi and late-night chai sessions near the college.
normalised: the government has announced a new education scheme, "padhai ka jugaad," launching on first april two thousand and twenty five. finally, a scheme that understands our struggle! apparently, it gives students a rupee five thousand monthly allowance to "explore educational opportunities." which, let's be honest, will probably go straight to maggi and late-night chai sessions near the college.

unnormalised: Under the scheme, you can avail a loan for laptops with a 0% interest rate, but only if you promise to use them *mostly* for studies (we see you, gamers!). Eligibility criteria include a valid Aadhaar card and proof that you’ve at least *attempted* to attend class 75% of the time. Good luck proving that one!
normalised: under the scheme, you can avail a loan for laptops with a zero percent interest rate, but only if you promise to use them mostly for studies (we see you, gamers!). eligibility criteria include a valid A-A-D-H-A-A-R card and proof that you’ve at least attempted to attend class seventy five percent of the time. good luck proving that one!

unnormalised: Education Minister Mr. Sharma claims this will boost literacy by 99.9%. We’re skeptical, but hey, free Maggi money sounds good. More details will be released on the PIB website, so keep refreshing... if you can spare some data from your YouTube binge.
normalised: education minister mister sharma claims this will boost literacy by ninety nine point nine percent. we’re skeptical, but hey, free maggi money sounds good. more details will be released on the P-I-B website, so keep refreshing... if you can spare some data from your youtube binge.
